âœ¨ c-blob-survival | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating a small, chaotic, and performant game inspired by Vampire Survivors.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Vampire Survivors-inspired gameplay â€¢ Written in C and raylib â€¢ Quad-tree for efficient collision detection â€¢ Single file architecture â€¢ Custom font
ðŸ“– Summary: Blob Survival is a small, chaotic game written in C and raylib, drawing inspiration from Vampire Survivors. It utilizes a quad-tree for efficient collision detection, enabling it to handle thousands of enemies. The game is contained within a single `game.c` file and features pixelated graphics, an upgrade system, and various enemy types.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ sshtron | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Playing a multiplayer lightcycle game through an SSH connection.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiplayer lightcycle game â€¢ Runs through SSH â€¢ Customizable player colors â€¢ Option to run your own copy via Go or Docker
ðŸ“– Summary: SSHTron is a multiplayer lightcycle game accessible via SSH. Players connect to a server and control lightcycles using WASD or vim keybindings, competing against others in a digital arena. The game can be easily played on a public server or self-hosted using Go or Docker, offering a unique and accessible gaming experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ immich | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Self-hosted photo and video management
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Upload and view videos and photos â€¢ Auto backup â€¢ Duplicate asset prevention â€¢ Album and Shared albums â€¢ Metadata view
ðŸ“– Summary: Immich is a high-performance, self-hosted solution for managing photos and videos. It offers features like automatic backup, duplicate prevention, multi-user support, and advanced search capabilities, providing a comprehensive alternative to cloud-based photo management services.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ siyuan | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Personal knowledge management with a focus on privacy and self-hosting.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Privacy-first â€¢ Self-hosted â€¢ Fully open source â€¢ Personal knowledge management â€¢ Markdown support
ðŸ“– Summary: Siyuan is a privacy-focused, self-hosted, and fully open-source personal knowledge management software. It allows users to create and manage their knowledge base locally, offering features like markdown support, Docker hosting, and WebDAV integration. The software is designed for individuals who prioritize data privacy and control over their personal knowledge.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ letta | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building stateful agents with memory, reasoning, and context management.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Stateful agents â€¢ Advanced reasoning capabilities â€¢ Transparent long-term memory â€¢ Model-agnostic framework â€¢ REST API
ðŸ“– Summary: Letta is a framework for building stateful agents with advanced reasoning and long-term memory. It provides tools for managing agent state, interacting with agents via REST API and SDKs, and a graphical Agent Development Environment. The framework is model-agnostic, allowing integration with various LLM API backends.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ InvoiceShelf | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and managing invoices and estimates for individuals and businesses.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Expense tracking â€¢ Payment tracking â€¢ Invoice creation â€¢ Estimate creation â€¢ Mobile apps (Android and iOS - Coming Soon)
ðŸ“– Summary: InvoiceShelf is an open-source invoicing solution that helps individuals and businesses track expenses, payments, and create professional invoices and estimates. It is a fork of Crater, focusing on stability, updates, and new features. The solution includes a web application built with Laravel and VueJS, and mobile apps built with React Native.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ kdenlive | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Video editing
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Professional-grade video editing capabilities â€¢ MLT Framework for video editing functionality â€¢ Qt and KDE Frameworks 6 for GUI â€¢ frei0r for video effects â€¢ LADSPA for audio effects
ðŸ“– Summary: Kdenlive is a free and open-source video editor that provides professional-grade video editing capabilities. It is built on the MLT Framework and KDE Frameworks, utilizing technologies like frei0r and LADSPA for video and audio effects. The primary use case is for creating and editing videos, ranging from simple home videos to complex projects.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ Nginx-Lua-Anti-DDoS | Lua
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Protecting Nginx web servers from DDoS attacks using Lua scripting and a Javascript-based authentication puzzle.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ DDoS Authentication HTML Page (I am Under Attack Mode) â€¢ IP Address Whitelisting/Blacklisting (IPv4 and IPv6) â€¢ User-Agent Whitelisting/Blacklisting
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides an Nginx Lua script designed to mitigate DDoS attacks. It features an 'I am Under Attack Mode' authentication page, IP and User-Agent whitelisting/blacklisting, and WAF capabilities to inspect various request components. Additionally, it offers caching, speed, and performance enhancements like query string manipulation and minification.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
